column9: My 8 year old son has been taking Intuniv for 3 weeks now.  He has titrated up to 2mg so far, but I noticed a difference the very first week!  He was taking Vyvanse 20mg, but we found that he had developed a tolerance for it.  When we attempted to increase his dose, 30mg was just too much for his little 50lb body to handle...he developed terrible side effects!  Tics, excessive talking, not sleeping, not eating.  So I did some research and found Intuniv.  I was skeptical, since it is newly used for this purpose (Tenex was the shorter acting version of this drug, which was used for Tourette's and high blood pressure).  But after thoroughly researching the clinical trials on both Intuniv AND Tenex, I decided that it couldn't hurt to give it a try.  After all, this isn't a stimulant...and the list of side effects is SIGNIFICANTLY shorter and less severe.  So far, it is fantastic stuff.  We're going with 20mg Vyvanse during the tiration period, and may or may not stop it once the Intuniv is fully effective.  If you are considering this one, especially if your child does not do well with stimulants, and Strattera didn't work for you (sure didn't for us!)...give it a shot.  I am pleasantly surprised, and pleased, that we don't have to increase the dose of stimulants anymore.  Awesome.
